org.apache.hadoop.service

Class TestGlobalStateChangeListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.junit.Assert
      • org.apache.hadoop.service.ServiceAssert
        • org.apache.hadoop.service.TestGlobalStateChangeListener

  • public class TestGlobalStateChangeListener
extends ServiceAssert
    Test global state changes. It is critical for all tests to clean up the global listener afterwards to avoid interfering with follow-on tests. One listener, listener is defined which is automatically unregistered on cleanup. All other listeners must be unregistered in the finally clauses of the tests.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TestGlobalStateChangeListener()

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void assertListenerEventCount(BreakableStateChangeListener breakable, int count)
      Assert that the number of state change notifications matches expectations.
      void assertListenerState(BreakableStateChangeListener breakable, Service.STATE state)
      Assert that the last state of the listener is that the test expected.
      void cleanup()
      After every test case reset the list of global listeners.
      void testEventHistory()
      Test that the BreakableStateChangeListener is picking up the state changes and that its last event field is as expected.
      void testListenerChain()
      Create a chain of listeners and set one in the middle to fail; verify that those in front got called, and those after did not.
      void testListenerFailure()
      This test triggers a failure in the listener - the expectation is that the service has already reached it's desired state, purely because the notifications take place afterwards.
      void testRegisterListener()
      Test that register/unregister works
      void testRegisterListenerTwice()
      Test that double registration results in one registration only.
